strings.Value: "How are you doing? Your guests behaving themselves?"
"How are things going in the city?"
"I need some supplies for the long road."

{n}A grumpy halfling tavernkeeper stares at you gloomily. His voice sounds indifferent, as he recites his memorized greeting.{/n} "Greetings from the best tavern in {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}. How may I help you?"
{n}The tavernkeeper mocks regret.{/n} "Come back again. Good riddance."
"Welcome, if you've got some coins in your pockets."
"How can they go? King Irovetti rules, painters paint, sailors drink, travelers roam the streets, bards compose their trifles. Everyone finding something to do – all to avoid doing anything."

{n}The tavernkeeper winces.{/n} "Great. King Irovetti is dead, long live the {mf|King|Queen} {name}. A whole new life. Except for the same old thieves. And the same drinking. And refusing to work. Otherwise, everything is just grand."

"Has my {mf|good sir|dear lady} tragically lost {mf|his|her} eyesight? Can't you see what's going on? The pirates will soon tear this tavern apart, board by board. – And the guardsmen don't dare come in here."
"Thank the gods everything is quiet. That's a rarity nowadays."

"Fair enough. As I understand it, you were the one who helped those river rascals find their way out of here?" {n}The tavernkeeper utters a deep sigh, and tries to place a note of gratitude in his voice.{/n} "This establishment is deeply grateful to you for your help."
"You can, if you have coin. If you don't – well, I'm not running charity here! Ten gold."
"Suit yourself. If you change it again, the price will be the same. Don't even try to haggle!"
